headline: Uber ordered to pay $8.5 million in key trial over driver sex assault claims
summary: Feb 5(Reuters) - A federal jury in Phoenix ordered Uber on Thursday to pay $8.5 million after finding it liable in a lawsuit brought by a woman who said she was sexually assaulted by a driver, ​a verdict that could influence thousands of similar cases against the ride-hailing company.

headline: Uber Technologies (UBER) Is Down 7.3% After Profit Miss And AV Expansion Plans - Has The Bull Case Changed?
summary: Uber Technologies recently reported fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 results, showing revenue growth to US$14.37 billion for the quarter and US$52.02 billion for the year, alongside a profit shortfall versus analyst expectations and the upcoming February 16, 2026 transition of CFO duties from Prashanth Mahendra‑Rajah to Balaji Krishnamurthy. At the same time, management doubled down on its autonomous vehicle ambitions, outlining plans to expand AV operations to 15 cities while using Uber’s...

headline: Citizens lifts Uber rating on valuation and AV strategy
summary: Investing.com -- Uber shares were upgraded to Market Outperform from Market Perform by Citizens analyst Andrew Boone in a note to clients this week, arguing that the company’s long-term autonomous vehicle strategy and valuation outweigh concerns about competitive pressure.

headline: Uber Hits 200 Million Monthly Users, Hires New CFO
summary: Uber Technologies, Inc. (NYSE:UBER) stock gained on Wednesday after the company reported its fiscal fourth-quarter 2025 results. The company reported a 20% year-over-year (Y/Y) revenue growth to $14.37 billion, surpassing the analyst consensus estimate of $14.32 billion. Uber reported adjusted EPS of 71 cents, which missed the analyst consensus estimate of 80 cents. Key Metrics Revenue from Mobility grew to $8.20 billion, up 19% Y/Y. Delivery was $4.89 billion, up 30%, and Freight was $1.27 bill

headline: Morning Movers: Eli Lilly rises, Boston Scientific falls after quarterly results
summary: Stock futures are mixed and have shown modest signs of stabilization after a sharp downturn in software and AI-related technology stocks yesterday, prompting some investors to treat the technology selloff that pressured equities broadly as a buying opportunity. Against that backdrop, defensive sectors and commodity-linked assets have drawn interest, particularly as gold reclaimed levels above $5,000 an ounce, reflecting continued demand for safe havens amid uncertainty. headline: OpenAI Introduces an Enterprise Platform for AI Agents
summary: Pervasive artificial-intelligence co-workers will be a reality by year end, according to OpenAI.  It is called Frontier, which is a new platform to help companies build, deploy, and manage AI agents.  “Frontier gives AI coworkers the ability to reason over data and complete complex tasks, like working with files, running code, and using tools,” OpenAI said in the blog post.

headline: WeRide Tests Robotaxi Economics With Abu Dhabi Permit And Uber Tie Up
summary: WeRide, listed as NasdaqGM:WRD, secured its first city level fully driverless robotaxi permit in Abu Dhabi. The permit supports a fully driverless robotaxi service that is planned to operate through a partnership with Uber. Alongside Abu Dhabi, WeRide is expanding internationally with new partnerships in markets including Saudi Arabia and Switzerland. WeRide focuses on autonomous driving technology and robotaxi services, and the new permit in Abu Dhabi puts its vehicles on public roads...

headline: UBER Q4 Deep Dive: User Growth, AV Strategy, and Margin Expansion in Focus
summary: Ride sharing and on-demand delivery platform Uber (NYSE:UBER) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 20.1% year on year to $14.37 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.71 per share was 9.6% below analysts’ consensus estimates.
